Function Documentation

template<class T>
T isis::util::_internal::TypeBase::as (  )  const [inline, inherited]

Interpret the value as value of any (other) type.

This is a runtime-based cast via automatic conversion. 

 TypeBase *mephisto=new Type<std::string>("666");
 int devil=mephisto->as<int>();
If you know the type of source and destination at compile time you should use Type<DEST_TYPE>((SOURCE_TYPE)src). 
 Type<std::string> mephisto("666");
 Type<int> devil((std::string)devil);
Returns:
value of any requested type parsed from toString(false).

template<typename T>
Type< T > & isis::util::_internal::TypeBase::cast_to_Type (  )  [inline, inherited]

Dynamically cast the TypeBase up to its actual Type<T>.

Referenced version. Will throw std::bad_cast if T is not the actual type. Will send an error if T is not the actual type and _ENABLE_CORE_LOG is true.

Returns:
a reference of the stored value.

Definition at line 206 of file type.hpp.

template<typename T>
const Type< T > & isis::util::_internal::TypeBase::cast_to_Type (  )  const [inline, inherited]

Dynamically cast the TypeBase up to its actual Type<T>.

Constant version. Will throw std::bad_cast if T is not the actual type. Will send an error if T is not the actual type and _ENABLE_CORE_LOG is true.

Returns:
a constant reference of the stored value.

Definition at line 196 of file type.hpp.

virtual TypeBase* isis::util::_internal::TypeBase::clone (  )  const [protected, pure virtual, inherited]

Create a copy of this.

Creates a new Type/TypePtr an stores a copy of its value there. Makes TypeBase-pointers copyable without knowing their type.

Returns:
a TypeBase-pointer to a newly created Type/TypePtr.

Implemented in isis::util::Type< TYPE >.

bool isis::util::_internal::TypeBase::convert ( const TypeBase &  from,
TypeBase &  to 
) [static, inherited]

Convert the content of one Type to another.

This will use the automatic conversion system to transform the value one Type-Object into another. The types of both objects can be unknown.

Parameters:
from the Type-object containing the value which should be converted
to the Type-object which will contain the converted value if conversion was successfull
Returns:
false if the conversion failed for any reason, true otherwise
